intro: Hieracium gonatophyllum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright purple flowers that bloom in the summer months, and it has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hieracium gonatophyllum is typically found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it can sometimes be invasive in certain regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and recognizable member of the hawkweed genus.
